intro: Capsella turoniensis, commonly known as the Turkish chickweed, is a low-growing annual plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically has hairy stems and leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are usually pink or white, and it produces small, round pods that contain several seeds. Capsella turoniensis is often found in disturbed soils and can be a common weed in agricultural fields.
